greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of blocks of size >= k in all set partitions of [n], assuming that every set partition contains one block of size zero; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for all n,k >= 0.  The triangle contains only the terms with k<=n.  T(n,k) = 0 for k>n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: T(3,2) = 4 because the number of blocks of size >= 2 in all set partitions of [3] (123, 12|3, 13|2, 1|23, 1|2|3) is 1+1+1+1+0 = 4.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n, j]*BellB[j], {j, 0, n - k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 14}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 30 2018 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 14 2017
